alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 10:51PM EDT until August 08 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHERN LEWIS AND SOUTHEASTERN OSWEGO COUNTIES... At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Central Square, Redfield, Highmarket, Whetstone Gulf State Park, Constantia, West Monroe, Martinsburg, Williamstown, Lyonsdale, Greig, Port Leyden, Lyons Falls, Constableville, Turin, Osceola, North Osceola, Swancott Mill, Kasoag, Mohawk Hill and West Leyden. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
